title: World Cup 2022: Nepalese workers trapped in a web of exploitation and forced labor
description: In recent years, the Dhanusha district in the east of Nepal has witnessed the largest number of workers leaving for Qatari construction sites.

title: France announces further supplies of weapons for Ukraine
description: Paris will supply Kyiv with two multiple-launch rocket systems and is considering sending radars, Armed Forces Minister Sébastien Lecornu said on Sunday, November 20.

title: Earthquake on Indonesia’s main island Java kills over 160 people, mostly children
description: A local governor said the 'majority' of those killed were children after a shallow 5.6-magnitude earthquake killed at least 162 people and toppled buildings on Indonesia's main island of Java on Monday.

title: French government slashes unemployment benefits
description: The French government announced that the time jobseekers can claim unemployment benefits would be reduced, as part of President Emmanuel Macron's promise to reach full employment.

title: World Cup 2022: French politicians divided over Qatar
description: Since the choice of the Gulf oil emirate in 2010 as the host country for the 2022 World Cup, politicians have dithered between acceptance and outrage.

title: Republican rivals eye 2024 presidential candidacy and show divides within GOP
description: Republicans gathered last weekend at a high-profile GOP conference in Las Vegas to weigh on Donald Trump and his alternatives after disappointing midterm results.

title: Qatar takes center stage at the opening of 'its' World Cup, except on the field
description: After a glorious opening ceremony, the host country lost to Ecuador (0-2) in the first match of the tournament on Sunday.

title: The reactivation of Trump's Twitter account is a symbolic decision
description: The former US president was banned from Twitter after the violent assault on the Capitol in January 2021. He has said, however, that he does not want to return.

title: Europe's space industry aims to compete with the US and China
description: The 22 ministers of the European Space Agency's member countries are meeting to establish the institution's budget for 2023-2025 and distribute it among the various programs.

title: World Cup 2022: Iran team refuses to sing national anthem
description: Iran is competing in the World Cup as a major women's protest movement is roiling the country.

title: World Cup 2022: 'Will Qatar be the most unpredictable World Cup in history?'
description: Played in unique conditions, this football World Cup in Qatar could also produce some unexpected results, says journalist Jérôme Latta.

title: Four 'torture' sites found in Kherson after Russian retreat
description: Ukrainian investigators say that they have found at least four places in Kherson that were used to torture prisoners of war, before Russian troops were forced to withdraw.

title: Former Arab enemies re-united in VIP seats at World Cup opening ceremony
description: On Sunday, the first day of the competition, the event allowed Qatari monarch Tamim Al-Thani to stage his country's return to prominence in the Middle East.

title: World Cup 2022: Politics dominate over football ahead of England's match against Iran
description: Attention turned to ongoing women's rights protests in Iran ahead of Monday's first round match against England.

title: The distress of the English middle class: 'We feel like we've been in recession since the beginning of the century'
description: In a series of articles, 'Le Monde' examines the deepening crisis that England is enduring, marked by political instability and a worsening social crisis. Part one visits Essex, an emblematic region where people are feeling the pinch.

title: The long history of Karim Benzema's thwarted attempts to play at World Cup
description: The French team's striker is ruled out for the tournament in Qatar after a thigh injury. It's the third time he's missed out on football's most prestigious competition.

title: Who is Eugen Rochko, the young tech whiz behind Mastodon?
description: In 2016, a 29-year-old German computer scientist founded the alternative, non-profit, decentralized social network Mastodon. People have been flocking to the site since Elon Musk's takeover of Twitter.

title: Multiple dead after earthquake shakes Indonesia's main island
description: A 5.6 magnitude earthquake rattled Java island on Monday killing dozens of people at least.

title: World Cup host Qatar once was a golden retirement home for French footballers and coaches
description: In the 2000s, Qatar coaxed former French stars for a well-paid early retirement. They discovered an exotic league and a country very new to the world of football.

title: Disney brings back former CEO Bob Iger
description: In a surprising development, Disney has brought back its former CEO while announcing Bob Chapek's departure.

title: Uprising in Iran: universities have become the beating heart of protest
description: Students are staging sit-ins, boycotting classes, demanding the release of arrested classmates and chanting slogans against the Islamic Republic, sometimes at the cost of their lives.

title: Iran carries out new strikes in Iraqi Kurdistan
description: Tehran accuses Kurdish-Iranian opposition groups based in northern Iraq of stoking the 'riots' at home and has stepped up its attacks since the protests began.

title: 'I ended up leaving the world of start-ups, fed up with the hypocrisy of a fake big family'
description: Léo, a 27-year-old French developer, describes the disillusionment he experienced at a 'scale-up,' a rapidly emerging start-up.

title: French nonprofit makes hunting accidents a political issue
description: The organization Un Jour Un Chasseur (One Day, a Hunter) was created by four friends after the death of Morgan Keane in 2020. It fights to spread the word on hunting accidents.

title: Zelensky's lesson to Israel
description: The Ukrainian president condemns the Russo-Iranian 'alliance' and urges Israel to support him in their fight against common enemies.

title: G7 calls for 'significant' UN action on North Korea
description: Pyongyang called UN chief Antonio Guterres 'a puppet of the United States' for joining US-led condemnation of North Korea's recent intercontinental ballistic missile test.

title: Iran: Religious leaders condemn regime amid increasing violence
description: Iran saw its most widespread demonstrations yet on November 16 and 17, while the clergy is openly questioning crackdown measures and challenging the supreme leader's authority.
